intro: Quinchamalium andinum, commonly known as the Andean quinchamalium, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Quinchamalium andinum is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and limited distribution.
